tagline: Jira is used for issue tracking and project management by over 25,000 customers in 122 countries around the globe.
description: Jira is used for issue tracking and project management by over 25,000 customers in 122 countries around the globe.
steps: Navigate to page with choosing pricing plan
Use your login and password as credentials to call getMyPermissions

blocks.name: getMyPermissions
blocks.description: Returns all permissions in the system and whether the currently logged in user has them.

args.name: projectKey
args.info: Key of project to scope returned permissions for.

args.name: projectId
args.info: Id of project to scope returned permissions for.

args.name: issueKey
args.info: Key of the issue to scope returned permissions for.

args.name: issueId
args.info: Id of the issue to scope returned permissions for.

blocks.name: getAllPermissions
blocks.description: Returns all permissions that are present in the JIRA instance - Global, Project and the global ones added by plugins.

blocks.name: getProperty
blocks.description: Returns an application property.

args.name: key
args.info: A String containing the property key. Example "jira.home".

args.name: permissionLevel
args.info: When fetching a list specifies the permission level of all items in the list.

args.name: keyFilter
args.info: When fetching a list allows the list to be filtered by the property's start of key e.g.

blocks.name: setProperty
blocks.description: Modify an application property via PUT.

args.name: value
args.info: If present in the PUT will override the existing value.

blocks.name: getAdvancedSettings
blocks.description: Returns the properties that are displayed on the "General Configuration > Advanced Settings" page.

blocks.name: getApplicationRoles
blocks.description: Returns all ApplicationRoles in the system. Will also return an ETag header containing a version hash of thecollection of ApplicationRoles.

blocks.name: getSingleApplicationRole
blocks.description: Returns the ApplicationRole with passed key if it exists.

blocks.name: getSingleAttachment
blocks.description: Returns the meta-data for an attachment, including the URI of the actual attached file.

blocks.name: removeSingleAttachment
blocks.description: Remove an attachment from an issue.

blocks.name: getAuditingRecords
blocks.description: Returns auditing records filtered using provided parameters.

args.name: filter
args.info: Text query, each record that will be returned must contain the provided text in one of its fields.

args.name: offset
args.info: The number of record from which search starts.

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of returned results (if is limit is <= 0 or > 1000, it will be set do default value: 1000).

args.name: from
args.info: Timestamp in past. 'from' must be less or equal 'to'

args.name: to
args.info: Timestamp in past; 'from' must be less or equal 'to'.

blocks.name: getAllSystemAvatars
blocks.description: Returns all system avatars of the given type.

blocks.name: getCommentPropertiesKeys
blocks.description: Returns the keys of all properties for the comment identified by the key or by the id.

blocks.name: deleteCommentProperty
blocks.description: Removes the property from the comment identified by the key or by the id. Ths user removing the property is requiredto have permissions to administer the comment.

blocks.name: setCommentProperty
blocks.description: Sets the value of the specified comment's property.

blocks.name: getCommentProperty
blocks.description: Returns the value of the property with a given key from the comment identified by the key or by the id.

blocks.name: createComponent
blocks.description: Create a component.

blocks.name: updateComponent
blocks.description: Modify a component.

blocks.name: getComponent
blocks.description: Returns a project component.

blocks.name: deleteComponent
blocks.description: Delete a project component.

args.name: moveIssuesTo
args.info: The new component applied to issues whose 'id' component will be deleted. If this value is null, then the 'id' component is simply removed from the related isues.

blocks.name: getComponentIssuesCounts
blocks.description: Returns counts of issues related to this component.

blocks.name: getConfiguration
blocks.description: Returns the information if the optional features in JIRA are enabled or disabled.

blocks.name: getSelectedTimeTracking
blocks.description: Returns the currently selected time-tracking implementation.

blocks.name: selectTimeTracking
blocks.description: Selects a time tracking implementation.

blocks.name: disableTimeTracking
blocks.description: Disables time tracking.

blocks.name: getTimeTrackingList
blocks.description: Retrieve the list of available time tracking implementations.

blocks.name: getTimeTrackingConfiguration
blocks.description: Returns the configuration options for time tracking.

blocks.name: setTimeTrackingConfiguration
blocks.description: Sets the options for time tracking.

blocks.name: getSingleCustomFieldOption
blocks.description: Returns a full representation of the Custom Field Option that has the given id.

blocks.name: getDashboards
blocks.description: Returns a list of all dashboards, optionally filtering them.

args.name: filter
args.info: An optional filter that is applied to the list of dashboards. Example "favourite", "my".

args.name: startAt
args.info: The index of the first dashboard to return (0-based). must be 0 or a multiple ofmaxResults.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: A hint as to the the maximum number of dashboards to return in each call.

blocks.name: getSingleDashboard
blocks.description: Returns a single dashboard.

blocks.name: getDashboardPropertiesKeys
blocks.description: Returns the keys of all properties for the dashboard item identified by the id.

blocks.name: deleteDashboardProperty
blocks.description: Removes the property from the dashboard item identified by the key or by the id.

blocks.name: setDashboardProperty
blocks.description: Sets the value of the specified dashboard item's property.

blocks.name: getDashboardProperty
blocks.description: Returns the value of the property with a given key from the dashboard item identified by the id.

blocks.name: createCustomField
blocks.description: Creates a custom field using a definition.

blocks.name: getFields
blocks.description: Returns a list of all fields, both System and Custom.

blocks.name: createSelectFieldOption
blocks.description: Creates an option for a select list issue field, for a given field key.

blocks.name: getSelectFieldOptions
blocks.description: Returns all options defined for a select list issue field, for a given field key.

args.name: startAt
args.info: The starting index of the returned objects. Base index: 0.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of items to return per page. Default: 50.

blocks.name: updateSelectFieldOptions
blocks.description: Updates an option for a select list issue field, for a given field key and option Id.

args.name: configScopeProjects
args.info: Comma separated options config scope projects identifier.

blocks.name: getSelectFieldSingleOption
blocks.description: Returns an option for a select list issue field, for a given field key and option Id.

blocks.name: deleteSelectFieldSingleOption
blocks.description: Deletes an option from a select list issue field, for a given field key and option Id.

blocks.name: getAvailableSelectFieldOptions
blocks.description: Returns the options defined for a select list issue field that are available to the currently logged-in user and can be assigned to an issue, for a given field key.

args.name: startAt
args.info: The starting index of the returned objects. Base index: 0.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of items to return per page. Default: 50.

args.name: projectId
args.info: Only options available for this project will be returned.

blocks.name: searchSelectFieldOptions
blocks.description: Returns the options defined for a select list issue field that are available to the currently logged-in user, for a given field key. The list of options will be paginated.

args.name: startAt
args.info: The starting index of the returned objects. Base index: 0.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of items to return per page. Default: 50.

args.name: projectId
args.info: Only options available for this project will be returned.

blocks.name: createFilter
blocks.description: Creates a new filter, and returns newly created filter.

args.name: sharePermissions
args.info: List of JSON objects, filter Permission.

args.name: sharedUsers
args.info: JSON Object, user Bean List Wrapper.

args.name: subscriptions
args.info: JSON Object, filter Subscription Bean List Wrapper.

blocks.name: updateFilter
blocks.description: Updates an existing filter, and returns its new value.

args.name: sharePermissions
args.info: List of JSON objects, filter Permission.

args.name: sharedUsers
args.info: JSON Object, user Bean List Wrapper.

args.name: subscriptions
args.info: JSON Object, filter Subscription Bean List Wrapper.

blocks.name: deleteFilter
blocks.description: Delete a filter.

blocks.name: getFilter
blocks.description: Returns a filter given an id.

blocks.name: getFilterDefaultColumns
blocks.description: Returns the default columns for the given filter.

blocks.name: setFilterDefaultColumns
blocks.description: Sets the default columns for the given filter.

blocks.name: resetFilterDefaultColumns
blocks.description: Resets the columns for the given filter such that the filter no longer has its own column config.

blocks.name: getFilterSharePermissions
blocks.description: Returns all share permissions of the given filter.

blocks.name: addFilterSharePermissions
blocks.description: Adds a share permissions to the given filter. Adding a global permission removes all previous permissions from the filter.

blocks.name: getFilterSingleSharePermission
blocks.description: Returns a single share permission of the given filter.

blocks.name: deleteFilterSingleSharePermission
blocks.description: Removes a share permissions from the given filter.

blocks.name: getDefaultShareScope
blocks.description: Returns the default share scope of the logged-in user.

blocks.name: setDefaultShareScope
blocks.description: Sets the default share scope of the logged-in user.

blocks.name: getFavouriteFilters
blocks.description: Returns the favourite filters of the logged-in user.

blocks.name: getMyFilters
blocks.description: Returns the owned filters of the logged-in user.

blocks.name: createGroup
blocks.description: Creates a group by given group parameter.

blocks.name: deleteGroup
blocks.description: Deletes a group by given group parameter.

args.name: groupname
args.info: The name of the group to delete.

args.name: swapGroup
args.info: Specify a different group to transfer the restrictions comments and worklogs to.

blocks.name: getUsersFromGroup
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of users who are members of the specified group and its subgroups.

args.name: groupname
args.info: A name of the group for which members will be returned.

args.name: includeInactiveUsers
args.info: Inactive users will be included in the response if set to true.

args.name: startAt
args.info: The index of the first user in group to return (0 based).

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of users to return (max 50).

blocks.name: addUserToGroup
blocks.description: Adds given user to a group. Returns the current state of the group.

blocks.name: deleteUserFromGroup
blocks.description: Removes given user from a group.

args.name: username
args.info: User to remove from a group.

blocks.name: findGroups
blocks.description: Returns groups with substrings matching a given query.

args.name: query
args.info: A String to match groups agains.

blocks.name: findUsersAndGroups
blocks.description: Returns a list of users and groups matching query with highlighting.

args.name: query
args.info: A string used to search username, Name or e-mail address.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of users to return (defaults to 50).

args.name: projectId
args.info: The list of project ids to further restrict the search.

args.name: issueTypeId
args.info: The list of issue type ids to further restrict the search.

blocks.name: createSingleIssue
blocks.description: Creates an issue or a sub-task from a JSON representation.

args.name: historyMetadata
args.info: JSON Object, new issue history metadata.

args.name: properties
args.info: List of JSON objects, entity properties.

blocks.name: createIssues
blocks.description: Creates issues or sub-tasks from a JSON representation. Creates many issues in one bulk operation.

args.name: issueUpdates
args.info: List of JSON objects, issue updates Object.

blocks.name: getSingleIssue
blocks.description: Returns a full representation of the issue for the given issue key.

args.name: fields
args.info: The list of fields to return for the issue. By default, all fields are returned.

args.name: properties
args.info: The list of properties to return for the issue.

args.name: fieldsByKeys
args.info: If true then fields in issues will be referenced by keys instead of ids.

blocks.name: deleteSingleIssue
blocks.description: Delete an issue.

blocks.name: updateSingleIssue
blocks.description: Edits an issue from a JSON representation.

args.name: notifyUsers
args.info: Send the email with notification that the issue was updated to users that watch it.

args.name: overrideScreenSecurity
args.info: Allows to update fields that are not on the screen.

args.name: overrideEditableFlag
args.info: Updates the issue even if the issue is not editable due to being in a status with jira.issue.editable set to false or missing.

args.name: properties
args.info: List of JSON objects, issue properties.

blocks.name: assignIssueToUser
blocks.description: Assigns an issue to a user.

blocks.name: getIssueComments
blocks.description: Returns all comments for an issue.

args.name: startAt
args.info: The page offset, if not specified then defaults to 0.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: How many results on the page should be included. Defaults to 50.

args.name: expand
args.info: Optional flags: renderedBody (provides body rendered in HTML).

blocks.name: addCommentToIssue
blocks.description: Adds a new comment to an issue.

args.name: expand
args.info: Optional flags: renderedBody (provides body rendered in HTML).

blocks.name: updateIssueComment
blocks.description: Updates an existing comment using its JSON representation.

args.name: expand
args.info: Optional flags: renderedBody (provides body rendered in HTML).

blocks.name: deleteIssueComment
blocks.description: Deletes an existing comment.

blocks.name: getIssueSingleComment
blocks.description: Returns a single comment.

args.name: expand
args.info: Optional flags: renderedBody (provides body rendered in HTML).

blocks.name: sendIssueNotify
blocks.description: Sends a notification (email) to the list or recipients defined in the request.

args.name: showToUsers
args.info: Array of JSON objects, show to users.

args.name: showToGroups
args.info: Array of JSON objects, show to groups.

args.name: restrictGroups
args.info: Array of JSON objects, restrict groups.

blocks.name: getRemoteIssueLinks
blocks.description: A REST sub-resource representing the remote issue links on the issue.

args.name: globalId
args.info: The id of the remote issue link to be returned.

blocks.name: createRemoteIssueLink
blocks.description: Create remote issue link from a JSON representation.

args.name: issueLinkStatusIconUrl
args.info: Remote issue link status icon Url.

args.name: issueLinkStatusIconTitle
args.info: Remote issue link status icon title.

args.name: issueLinkStatusIconLink
args.info: Remote issue link status icon link.

blocks.name: deleteRemoteIssueLinkByGlobalId
blocks.description: Delete the remote issue link with the given global id on the issue.

args.name: globalId
args.info: The global id of the remote issue link.

blocks.name: getRemoteIssueLinkById
blocks.description: Get the remote issue link with the given id on the issue.

blocks.name: updateRemoteIssueLink
blocks.description: Updates a remote issue link from a JSON representation.

args.name: issueLinkStatusIconUrl
args.info: Remote issue link status icon Url.

args.name: issueLinkStatusIconTitle
args.info: Remote issue link status icon title.

args.name: issueLinkStatusIconLink
args.info: Remote issue link status icon link.

blocks.name: deleteRemoteIssueLinkById
blocks.description: Delete the remote issue link with the given id on the issue.

blocks.name: getIssueTransitions
blocks.description: Get a list of the transitions possible for this issue by the current user, along with fields that are required and their types.

args.name: skipRemoteOnlyCondition
args.info: Flag to skip evaluation of {@link RemoteOnlyCondition}, can only be used by add-on users.

blocks.name: makeIssueTransition
blocks.description: Perform a transition on an issue.When performing the transition you can update or set other issue fields.

blocks.name: deleteIssueVote
blocks.description: Remove your vote from an issue. (i.e. "unvote").

blocks.name: addIssueVote
blocks.description: Cast your vote in favour of an issue.

blocks.name: getIssueVotes
blocks.description: A REST sub-resource representing the voters on the issue.

blocks.name: getIssueWatchers
blocks.description: Returns the list of watchers for the issue with the given key.

blocks.name: addIssueWatcher
blocks.description: Adds a user to an issue's watcher list.

blocks.name: deleteIssueWatcher
blocks.description: Removes a user from an issue's watcher list.

args.name: username
args.info: A String containing the name of the user to remove from the watcher list.

blocks.name: getWorklogById
blocks.description: Returns a specific worklog.

blocks.name: addIssueWorklog
blocks.description: Adds a new worklog entry to an issue.

args.name: adjustEstimate
args.info: Allows you to provide specific instructions to update the remaining time estimate of the issue.

args.name: newEstimate
args.info: The new value for the remaining estimate field.

args.name: reduceBy
args.info: The amount to reduce the remaining estimate by.

blocks.name: getIssueWorklog
blocks.description: Returns a specific worklog.

blocks.name: updateIssueWorklog
blocks.description: Updates an existing worklog entry.

args.name: adjustEstimate
args.info: Allows you to provide specific instructions to update the remaining time estimate of the issue.

args.name: newEstimate
args.info: The new value for the remaining estimate field.

args.name: reduceBy
args.info: The amount to reduce the remaining estimate by.

blocks.name: deleteIssueWorklog
blocks.description: Deletes an existing worklog entry.

args.name: adjustEstimate
args.info: Allows you to provide specific instructions to update the remaining time estimate of the issue.

args.name: newEstimate
args.info: The new value for the remaining estimate field.

args.name: increaseBy
args.info: The amount to increase the remaining estimate by e.g.

blocks.name: getCreatedIssueMeta
blocks.description: Returns the meta data for creating issues.

args.name: projectIds
args.info: List, combined with the projectKeys param, lists the projects with which to filter the results.

args.name: projectKeys
args.info: List, combined with the projectIds param, lists the projects with which to filter the results.

args.name: issuetypeIds
args.info: List, combinded with issuetypeNames, lists the issue types with which to filter the results.

args.name: issuetypeNames
args.info: List, Combinded with issuetypeIds, lists the issue types with which to filter the results. If null, all issue types are returned.

blocks.name: getIssuesBasedOnQuery
blocks.description: Returns suggested issues which match the auto-completion query for the user which executes this request.

args.name: currentJQL
args.info: The JQL in context of which the request is executed.

args.name: currentIssueKey
args.info: The key of the issue in context of which the request is executed.

args.name: currentProjectId
args.info: The id of the project in context of which the request is executed.

args.name: showSubTasks
args.info: If set to false, subtasks will not be included in the list.

args.name: showSubTaskParent
args.info: If set to false and request is executed in context of a subtask, the parent issue will not be included in the auto-completion result, even if it matches the query.

blocks.name: addIssueAttachment
blocks.description: Add attachment to an issue.

blocks.name: getIssuePropertiesKeys
blocks.description: Returns the keys of all properties for the issue identified by the key or by the id.

blocks.name: deleteIssueProperty
blocks.description: Removes the property from the issue identified by the key or by the id.

blocks.name: setIssueProperty
blocks.description: Sets the value of the specified issue's property. You can use this resource to store a custom data against the issue identified by the key or by the id.

blocks.name: getIssueProperty
blocks.description: Returns the value of the property with a given key from the issue identified or the key.

blocks.name: getWorklogPropertiesKeys
blocks.description: Returns the keys of all properties for the worklog identified by the key or by the id.

blocks.name: deleteWorklogProperty
blocks.description: Removes the property from the worklog identified by the key or by the id.

blocks.name: setWorklogProperty
blocks.description: Sets the value of the specified worklog's property.

blocks.name: getWorklogProperty
blocks.description: Returns the value of the property with a given key from the worklog identified by the key or by the id.

blocks.name: createIssueLink
blocks.description: Creates an issue link between two issues.

args.name: commentProperties
args.info: List of JSON objects, comment entity property.

blocks.name: getIssueLink
blocks.description: Returns an issue link with the specified id.

blocks.name: deleteIssueLink
blocks.description: Deletes an issue link with the specified id.

blocks.name: getIssueLinkTypes
blocks.description: Returns a list of available issue link types, if issue linking is enabled.

blocks.name: createIssueLinkType
blocks.description: Create a new issue link type.

blocks.name: getSingleIssueLinkType
blocks.description: Returns for a given issue link type identifier all information about this issue link type.

blocks.name: deleteSingleIssueLinkType
blocks.description: Delete the specified issue link type.

blocks.name: updateSingleIssueLinkType
blocks.description: Update the specified issue link type.

blocks.name: getIssueSecuritySchemes
blocks.description: Returns all issue security schemes that are defined.

blocks.name: getIssueSingleSecurityScheme
blocks.description: Returns the issue security scheme along with that are defined.

blocks.name: getIssueAllTypes
blocks.description: Returns a list of all issue types visible to the user.

blocks.name: createIssueType
blocks.description: Creates an issue type.

blocks.name: getSingleIssueType
blocks.description: Returns a full representation of the issue type that has the given id.

blocks.name: deleteSingleIssueType
blocks.description: Deletes the specified issue type.

args.name: alternativeIssueTypeId
args.info: The identifier of an issue type to which issues associated with the removed issue type will be migrated.

blocks.name: updateSingleIssueType
blocks.description: Updates the specified issue type from a JSON representation.

blocks.name: getAlternativeIssueTypes
blocks.description: Returns a list of all alternative issue types for the given issue type identifier.

blocks.name: createIssueTypeAvatar
blocks.description: Creates an avatar for an issue type, for a given issue type Id.

args.name: x
args.info: The X coordinate of the top-left corner of the crop region. Default: 0.

args.name: y
args.info: The Y coordinate of the top-left corner of the crop region. Default: 0.

args.name: size
args.info: The length of each side of the crop region. The crop region can only be a square.

blocks.name: getIssueTypePropertiesKeys
blocks.description: Returns the keys of all properties for the issue type identified by the id.

blocks.name: deleteIssueTypeProperty
blocks.description: Removes the property from the issue type identified by the id.

blocks.name: setIssueTypeProperty
blocks.description: Sets the value of the specified issue type's property.

blocks.name: getIssueTypeProperty
blocks.description: Returns the value of the property with a given key from the issue type identified by the id.

blocks.name: getAutoComplete
blocks.description: Returns the auto complete data required for JQL searches.

blocks.name: getFieldAutoComplete
blocks.description: Returns auto complete suggestions for JQL search.

args.name: fieldName
args.info: The field name for which the suggestions are generated.

args.name: fieldValue
args.info: The portion of the field value that has already been provided by the user.

args.name: predicateName
args.info: The predicate for which the suggestions are generated. Suggestions are generated only for: "by", "from" and "to".

args.name: predicateValue
args.info: The portion of the predicate value that has already been provided by the user.

blocks.name: getMyPreferences
blocks.description: Returns preference of the currently logged in user.

args.name: key
args.info: Key of the preference to be returned.

blocks.name: setMyPreference
blocks.description: Sets preference of the currently logged in user.

args.name: key
args.info: Key of the preference to be set.

blocks.name: deleteMyPreference
blocks.description: Removes preference of the currently logged in user.

args.name: key
args.info: Key of the preference to be removed.

blocks.name: getMe
blocks.description: Returns currently logged user.

blocks.name: getNotificationSchemes
blocks.description: Returns a paginated list of notification schemes.

args.name: startAt
args.info: The index of the first notification scheme to return (0 based).

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of notification schemes to return (max 50).

blocks.name: getSingleNotificationScheme
blocks.description: Returns a full representation of the notification scheme for the given id.

blocks.name: getPermissionSchemes
blocks.description: Returns a list of all permission schemes.

blocks.name: createPermissionScheme
blocks.description: Create a new permission scheme.

blocks.name: getSinglePermissionScheme
blocks.description: Returns a permission scheme identified by the given id.

blocks.name: deletePermissionScheme
blocks.description: Deletes a permission scheme identified by the given id.

blocks.name: updatePermissionScheme
blocks.description: Updates a permission scheme.

blocks.name: getPermissionSchemeGrants
blocks.description: Returns all permission grants of the given permission scheme.

blocks.name: createPermissionGrant
blocks.description: Creates a permission grant in a permission scheme.

blocks.name: deletePermissionSchemeEntity
blocks.description: Deletes a permission grant from a permission scheme.

blocks.name: getPermissionSchemeGrant
blocks.description: Returns a permission grant identified by the given id.

blocks.name: getPriorities
blocks.description: Returns a list of all issue priorities.

blocks.name: getSinglePriority
blocks.description: Returns an issue priority.

blocks.name: getAllProjects
blocks.description: Returns all projects which are visible for the currently logged in user.

args.name: recent
args.info: If this parameter is set then only projects recently accessed by the current user.

blocks.name: createProject
blocks.description: Creates a new project.

blocks.name: updateProject
blocks.description: Updates a project.

args.name: expand
args.info: The parameters to expand in returned project.

blocks.name: deleteProject
blocks.description: Deletes a project.

blocks.name: getSingleProject
blocks.description: Contains a full representation of a project in JSON format.

blocks.name: updateProjectAvatar
blocks.description: Update project avatar

blocks.name: deleteProjectAvatar
blocks.description: Deletes avatar.

blocks.name: createProjectAvatar
blocks.description: Creates an avatar for a project, for a given project Id or project key.

args.name: x
args.info: The X coordinate of the top-left corner of the crop region. Default: 0.

args.name: y
args.info: The Y coordinate of the top-left corner of the crop region. Default: 0.

args.name: size
args.info: The length of each side of the crop region. The crop region can only be a square.

blocks.name: getProjectComponents
blocks.description: Contains a full representation of a the specified project's components.

blocks.name: getAllProjectStatuses
blocks.description: Get all issue types with valid status values for a project.

blocks.name: updateProjectType
blocks.description: Updates the type of a project.

blocks.name: getProjectVersionsPaginated
blocks.description: Returns all versions for the specified project.

args.name: startAt
args.info: The page offset, if not specified then defaults to 0.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: How many results on the page should be included. Defaults to 50.

blocks.name: getProjectPropertiesKeys
blocks.description: Returns the keys of all properties for the project identified by the key or by the id.

blocks.name: deleteProjectProperty
blocks.description: Removes the property from the project identified by the key or by the id.

blocks.name: setProjectProperty
blocks.description: Sets the value of the specified project's property.

blocks.name: getProjectProperty
blocks.description: Returns the value of the property with a given key from the project identified by the key or by the id.

blocks.name: getSingleProjectRoles
blocks.description: Returns all roles in the given project Id or key, with links to full details on each role.

blocks.name: getProjectSingleRole
blocks.description: Returns the details for a given project role in a project together with project role actors.

blocks.name: setRoleActors
blocks.description: Updates a project role to include the specified actors (users or groups).

blocks.name: addActorToProjectRole
blocks.description: Adds an actor (user or group) to a project role.

args.name: actors
args.info: JSON Object, of users or group.

blocks.name: deleteActorFromProjectRole
blocks.description: Deletes actors (users or groups) from a project role.

args.name: user
args.info: The username to remove from the project role.

args.name: group
args.info: The groupname to remove from the project role.

blocks.name: getIssueSecurityScheme
blocks.description: Returns the issue security scheme for project.

blocks.name: getNotificationScheme
blocks.description: Gets a notification scheme associated with the project.

blocks.name: getAssignedPermissionScheme
blocks.description: Gets a permission scheme assigned with a project.

blocks.name: assignPermissionScheme
blocks.description: Assigns a permission scheme with a project.

blocks.name: getSecurityLevelsForProject
blocks.description: Returns all security levels for the project that the current logged in user has access to.

blocks.name: getAllProjectTypes
blocks.description: Returns all the project types defined on the JIRA instance.

blocks.name: getProjectTypeByKey
blocks.description: Returns the project type with the given key.

blocks.name: getAccessibleProjectTypeByKey
blocks.description: Returns the project type with the given key, if it is accessible to the logged in user.

blocks.name: getAllProjectCategories
blocks.description: Returns all project categories.

blocks.name: createProjectCategory
blocks.description: Create a project category.

blocks.name: getProjectCategoryById
blocks.description: Contains a representation of a project category in JSON format.

blocks.name: deleteProjectCategory
blocks.description: Delete a project category.

blocks.name: updateProjectCategory
blocks.description: Modify a project category.

blocks.name: validateProject
blocks.description: Validates a project key.

blocks.name: getResolutions
blocks.description: Returns a list of all resolutions.

blocks.name: getSingleResolution
blocks.description: Returns a resolution.

blocks.name: getProjectRoles
blocks.description: Get all the ProjectRoles available in JIRA. Currently this list is global.

blocks.name: createProjectRole
blocks.description: Creates a new ProjectRole to be available in JIRA.

blocks.name: getProjectRolesById
blocks.description: Get a specific ProjectRole available in JIRA.

blocks.name: updateProjectRole
blocks.description: Fully updates a roles.

blocks.name: deleteProjectRole
blocks.description: Deletes a role.

args.name: swap
args.info: If given, removes a role even if it is used in scheme by replacing the role with the given one.

blocks.name: getDefaultActorsForRole
blocks.description: Gets default actors for the given role.

blocks.name: addDefaultActorsToRole
blocks.description: Adds default actors to the given role. The request data should contain a list of usernames or a list of groups to add.

blocks.name: deleteDefaultActorFromRole
blocks.description: Removes default actor from the given role.

args.name: user
args.info: If given, removes an actor from given role.

args.name: group
args.info: If given, removes an actor from given role.

blocks.name: getScreenFieldsToAdd
blocks.description: Gets available fields for screen.

blocks.name: getAllScreenTabs
blocks.description: Returns a list of all tabs for the given screen.

blocks.name: addScreenTab
blocks.description: Creates tab for given screen.

blocks.name: renameScreenTab
blocks.description: Renames tab on given screen.

blocks.name: deleteScreenTab
blocks.description: Deletes tab to give screen.

blocks.name: getAllScreenFields
blocks.description: Gets all fields for a given tab.

blocks.name: addScreenField
blocks.description: Adds field to the given tab.

blocks.name: removeScreenField
blocks.description: Removes field from given tab.

blocks.name: moveScreenFieldByNeighbours
blocks.description: Moves field on the given tab.

args.name: after
args.info: A field to place this field after. The value should be the self link of another field.

blocks.name: moveScreenFieldByPosition
blocks.description: Moves field on the given tab.

blocks.name: moveScreenTab
blocks.description: Moves tab position.

blocks.name: addFieldToDefaultScreen
blocks.description: Adds field or custom field to the default tab.

blocks.name: search
blocks.description: Performs a search using JQL.

blocks.name: getIssuesecuritylevel
blocks.description: Returns a full representation of the security level that has the given identifier.

blocks.name: getServerInfo
blocks.description: Returns general information about the current JIRA server.

blocks.name: setBaseURL
blocks.description: Sets the base URL that is configured for this JIRA instance.

blocks.name: getIssueNavigatorDefaultColumns
blocks.description: Returns the default system columns for issue navigator.

blocks.name: setIssueNavigatorDefaultColumns
blocks.description: Sets the default system columns for issue navigator.

blocks.name: getStatuses
blocks.description: Returns a list of all statuses.

blocks.name: getSingleStatus
blocks.description: Returns a full representation of the Status having the given id or name.

blocks.name: getStatusCategories
blocks.description: Returns a list of all status categories.

blocks.name: getStatusCategory
blocks.description: Returns a full representation of the StatusCategory having the given id or key.

args.name: idOrKey
args.info: Identifier or key of status category.

blocks.name: createAvatar
blocks.description: Creates an avatar for a given entity.

args.name: type
args.info: Universal avatar type. Example project, user, issuetype.

args.name: x
args.info: The X coordinate of the top-left corner of the crop region.

args.name: y
args.info: The Y coordinate of the top-left corner of the crop region.

args.name: size
args.info: The length of each side of the crop region. The crop region can only be a square.

blocks.name: getAvatars
blocks.description: Get avatars.

args.name: type
args.info: Universal avatar type. Example project, user, issuetype.

blocks.name: deleteAvatar
blocks.description: Deletes avatar.

args.name: type
args.info: Universal avatar type. Example project, user, issuetype.

blocks.name: getUser
blocks.description: Returns a user.

blocks.name: findBulkAssignableUsers
blocks.description: Returns a list of users that match the search string and can be assigned issues for all the given projects.

args.name: projectKeys
args.info: List of the projects keys we are finding assignable users for.

args.name: startAt
args.info: The index of the first user to return.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of users to return.

blocks.name: findAssignableUsers
blocks.description: Returns a list of users that match the search string.

args.name: project
args.info: The key of the project we are finding assignable users for.

args.name: issueKey
args.info: The issue key for the issue being edited we need to find assignable users for.

args.name: startAt
args.info: The index of the first user to return.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of users to return.

blocks.name: getDefaultColumns
blocks.description: Returns the default columns for the given user.

blocks.name: setColumns
blocks.description: Sets the default columns for the given user.

blocks.name: resetDefaultColumns
blocks.description: Reset the default columns for the given user to the system default.

blocks.name: findUsersWithAllPermissions
blocks.description: Returns a list of active users that match the search string and have all specified permissions for the project or issue.

args.name: permissions
args.info: List of permissions for project or issue returned users must have.

args.name: projectKey
args.info: The optional project key to search for users with if no issueKey is supplied.

args.name: issueKey
args.info: The issue key for the issue for which returned users have specified permissions.

args.name: username
args.info: The username filter, list includes all users if unspecified.

args.name: startAt
args.info: The index of the first user to return.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of users to return.

blocks.name: findUsersByProperty
blocks.description: Returns a list of users that match the search string and/or property.

args.name: property
args.info: A query string used to search by property. Example: propertyKey.something.nested=1.

args.name: username
args.info: A query string used to search username, name or e-mail address.

args.name: includeActive
args.info: If true, then active users are included in the results.

args.name: includeInactive
args.info: If true, then inactive users are included in the results.

args.name: startAt
args.info: The index of the first user to return.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of users to return.

blocks.name: findUsersByUsername
blocks.description: Returns a list of users that match the search string and/or property.

args.name: username
args.info: A query string used to search username, name or e-mail address.

args.name: property
args.info: A query string used to search by property. Example: propertyKey.something.nested=1.

args.name: includeActive
args.info: If true, then active users are included in the results.

args.name: includeInactive
args.info: If true, then inactive users are included in the results.

args.name: startAt
args.info: The index of the first user to return.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of users to return.

blocks.name: findUsersWithBrowsePermission
blocks.description: Returns a list of active users that match the search string.

args.name: username
args.info: The username filter, no users returned if left blank.

args.name: projectKey
args.info: Project key to search for users with if no issueKey is supplied.

args.name: issueKey
args.info: The issue key for the issue being edited we need to find viewable users for.

args.name: startAt
args.info: The index of the first user to return.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of users to return.

blocks.name: getUserPropertiesKeysByUserKey
blocks.description: Returns the keys of all properties for the user identified by the key.

args.name: userKey
args.info: Key of the user whose properties are to be returned.

blocks.name: getUserPropertiesKeysByUsername
blocks.description: Returns the keys of all properties for the user identified by the username.

args.name: username
args.info: Username of the user whose properties are to be returned.

blocks.name: deleteUserPropertyByUserKey
blocks.description: Removes the property from the user identified by the key.

args.name: userKey
args.info: Key of the user whose property is to be removed.

blocks.name: deleteUserPropertyByUsername
blocks.description: Removes the property from the user identified by the username.

args.name: username
args.info: Username of the user whose property is to be removed.

blocks.name: setUserPropertyByUserKey
blocks.description: Sets the value of the specified user's property.

args.name: userKey
args.info: Key of the user whose property is to be set.

blocks.name: setUserPropertyByUsername
blocks.description: Sets the value of the specified user's property.

args.name: username
args.info: Username of the user whose property is to be set.

blocks.name: getUserPropertyByUserKey
blocks.description: Returns the value of the property with a given key from the user identified by the key or by the id.

args.name: userKey
args.info: Key of the user whose property is to be returned.

blocks.name: getUserPropertyByUsername
blocks.description: Returns the value of the property with a given key from the user identified by the username.

args.name: username
args.info: Username of the user whose property is to be returned.

blocks.name: createVersion
blocks.description: Create a version.

args.name: operations
args.info: List of JSON objects, simple Links.

args.name: remotelinks
args.info: Array of JSON objects, remote Entity Links.

blocks.name: moveVersionByNeighbours
blocks.description: Modify a version's sequence within a project.

args.name: after
args.info: A version to place this version after. The value should be the self link of another version.

blocks.name: moveVersionByPosition
blocks.description: Modify a version's sequence within a project.

blocks.name: getVersion
blocks.description: Returns a project version.

blocks.name: updateVersion
blocks.description: Modify a version.

args.name: moveUnfixedIssuesTo
args.info: Move unfixed issues to. The value should be the link.

args.name: operations
args.info: Array of JSON objects, simple Links.

args.name: remotelinks
args.info: Array of JSON objects, remote Entity Links.

blocks.name: deleteVersion
blocks.description: Delete a project version.

args.name: moveFixIssuesTo
args.info: The version to set fixVersion to on issues where the deleted version is the fix version.

args.name: moveAffectedIssuesTo
args.info: The version to set affectedVersion to on issues where the deleted version is the affected version.

blocks.name: mergeVersion
blocks.description: Merge versions.

blocks.name: getVersionRelatedIssues
blocks.description: Returns a bean containing the number of fixed in and affected issues for the given version.

blocks.name: getVersionUnresolvedIssues
blocks.description: Returns the number of unresolved issues for the given version.

blocks.name: getRemoteVersionLinksByVersionId
blocks.description: Returns the remote version links associated with the given version ID.

blocks.name: createRemoteVersionLink
blocks.description: Create a remote version link.

blocks.name: updateRemoteVersionLink
blocks.description: Update a remote version link.

blocks.name: deleteRemoteVersionLinks
blocks.description: Delete all remote version links for a given version ID.

blocks.name: getRemoteVersionLink
blocks.description: A REST sub-resource representing a remote version link.

blocks.name: deleteSingleRemoteVersionLink
blocks.description: Delete a specific remote version link with the given version ID and global ID.

blocks.name: getRemoteVersionLinks
blocks.description: Returns the remote version links for a given global ID.

args.name: globalId
args.info: The global ID of the remote resource that is linked to the versions.

blocks.name: getAllWorkflows
blocks.description: Returns all workflows.

blocks.name: deleteWorkflowProperty
blocks.description: Delete a property from the passed transition on the passed workflow.

args.name: key
args.info: The name of the property to add.

args.name: workflowName
args.info: The name of the workflow to use.

args.name: workflowMode
args.info: The type of workflow to use. One of "live", "draft".

blocks.name: createWorkflowProperty
blocks.description: Add a new property to a transition.

args.name: key
args.info: The name of the property to add.

args.name: workflowName
args.info: The name of the workflow to use.

args.name: workflowMode
args.info: The type of workflow to use. One of "live", "draft".

blocks.name: updateWorkflowProperty
blocks.description: Update property to a transition.

args.name: key
args.info: The name of the property to add.

args.name: value
args.info: The value of the property to add.

args.name: workflowName
args.info: The name of the workflow to use.

args.name: workflowMode
args.info: The type of workflow to use. One of "live", "draft".

blocks.name: getWorkflowProperties
blocks.description: Return the property or properties associated with a transition.

args.name: workflowName
args.info: The name of the workflow to use.

args.name: key
args.info: The name of the property key to query.

args.name: workflowMode
args.info: The type of workflow to use. One of "live", "draft".

args.name: includeReservedKeys
args.info: Set this to true in order to include the non-editable keys in the response.

blocks.name: createWorkflowScheme
blocks.description: Create a new workflow scheme.

args.name: originalIssueTypeMappings
args.info: JSON Object, original issue type mappings.

args.name: updateDraftIfNeeded
args.info: If set to true, indicate that the draft should be created/updated when the actual scheme cannot be edited.

blocks.name: deleteWorkflowScheme
blocks.description: Delete the passed workflow scheme.

blocks.name: getWorkflowScheme
blocks.description: Returns the requested workflow scheme to the caller.

args.name: returnDraftIfExists
args.info: When true indicates that a scheme's draft.

blocks.name: updateWorkflowScheme
blocks.description: Update the passed workflow scheme.

args.name: updateDraftIfNeeded
args.info: If set to true, indicate that the draft should be created/updated when the actual scheme cannot be edited.

args.name: originalIssueTypeMappings
args.info: JSON Object, original issue type mappings.

blocks.name: createDraftForScheme
blocks.description: Create a draft for the passed scheme. The draft will be a copy of the state of the parent.

blocks.name: deleteDefaultWorkflowScheme
blocks.description: Remove the default workflow from the passed workflow scheme.

args.name: updateDraftIfNeeded
args.info: When true will create and return a draft when the workflow scheme cannot be edited.

blocks.name: updateDefaultWorkflowScheme
blocks.description: Set the default workflow for the passed workflow scheme.

args.name: updateDraftIfNeeded
args.info: If set to true, indicate that the draft should be created/updated when the actual scheme cannot be edited.

blocks.name: getDefaultWorkflowScheme
blocks.description: Return the default workflow from the passed workflow scheme.

args.name: returnDraftIfExists
args.info: When true indicates that a scheme's draft.

blocks.name: getDraftWorkflowScheme
blocks.description: Returns the requested draft workflow scheme to the caller.

blocks.name: deleteDraftWorkflowScheme
blocks.description: Delete the passed draft workflow scheme.

blocks.name: updateDraftWorkflowScheme
blocks.description: Update a draft workflow scheme.

args.name: updateDraftIfNeeded
args.info: If set to true, indicate that the draft should be created/updated when the actual scheme cannot be edited.

args.name: originalIssueTypeMappings
args.info: JSON Object, original issue type mappings.

blocks.name: getDefaultDraftWorkflowScheme
blocks.description: Return the default workflow from the passed draft workflow scheme to the caller.

blocks.name: deleteDefaultDraftWorkflowScheme
blocks.description: Remove the default workflow from the passed draft workflow scheme.

blocks.name: updateDefaultDraftWorkflowScheme
blocks.description: Set the default workflow for the passed draft workflow scheme.

args.name: updateDraftIfNeeded
args.info: If set to true, indicate that the draft should be created/updated when the actual scheme cannot be edited.

blocks.name: getDraftSchemeIssueType
blocks.description: Returns the issue type mapping for the passed draft workflow scheme.

blocks.name: deleteDraftSchemeIssueType
blocks.description: Remove the specified issue type mapping from the draft scheme.

blocks.name: setDraftSchemeIssueType
blocks.description: Set the issue type mapping for the passed draft scheme.

args.name: updateDraftIfNeeded
args.info: If set to true, indicate that the draft should be created/updated when the actual scheme cannot be edited.

blocks.name: getDraftWorkflow
blocks.description: Returns the draft workflow mappings or requested mapping to the caller.

blocks.name: deleteDraftWorkflowMapping
blocks.description: Delete the passed workflow from the draft workflow scheme.

args.name: workflowName
args.info: The name of the workflow to delete.

blocks.name: updateDraftWorkflowMapping
blocks.description: Update the draft scheme to include the passed mapping.

args.name: workflowName
args.info: The name of the workflow mapping to update.

args.name: issueTypes
args.info: List of Strings, issue types array.

args.name: updateDraftIfNeeded
args.info: If set to true, indicate that the draft should be created/updated when the actual scheme cannot be edited.

blocks.name: getWorkflowSchemeIssueType
blocks.description: Returns the issue type mapping for the passed workflow scheme.

args.name: returnDraftIfExists
args.info: When true indicates that a scheme's draft.

args.info: When true will create and return a draft when the workflow scheme cannot be edited.

blocks.name: setWorkflowSchemeIssueType
blocks.description: Set the issue type mapping for the passed scheme.

args.name: updateDraftIfNeeded
args.info: If set to true, indicate that the draft should be created/updated when the actual scheme cannot be edited.

blocks.name: getWorkflow
blocks.description: Returns the workflow mappings or requested mapping to the caller for the passed scheme.

args.name: returnDraftIfExists
args.info: When true indicates that a scheme's draft.

blocks.description: Delete the passed workflow from the workflow scheme.

args.info: The name of the workflow to delete.

args.name: updateDraftIfNeeded
args.info: Flag to indicate if a draft should be created if necessary to delete the workflowfrom the scheme.

args.info: If set to true, indicate that the draft should be created/updated when the actual scheme cannot be edited.

blocks.name: getWorklogsDeletedSince
blocks.description: Returns worklogs id and delete time of worklogs that was deleted since given time.

args.name: since
args.info: A date time in unix timestamp format since when deleted worklogs will be returned.

blocks.name: getWorklogs
blocks.description: Returns worklogs for given worklog ids. Only worklogs to which the calling user has permissions, will be included in the result.

blocks.name: getWorklogsModifiedSince
blocks.description: Returns worklogs id and update time of worklogs that was updated since given time.

args.name: since
args.info: A date time in unix timestamp format since when updated worklogs will be returned.
